intro: Adenandra villiersii, commonly known as the Natal holly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its berries are red or orange when mature and are an important food source for birds and small mammals. Adenandra villiersii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
